userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?

condition.description:
Alzheimer's disease (AD) is the most common form of dementia among older people. Dementia is a brain disorder that seriously affects a person's ability to carry out daily activities.

AD begins slowly. It first involves the parts of the brain that control thought, memory and language. People with AD may have trouble remembering things that happened recently or names of people they know. A related problem, mild cognitive impairment (MCI), causes more memory problems than normal for people of the same age. Many, but not all, people with MCI will develop AD.

In AD, over time, symptoms get worse. People may not recognize family members or have trouble speaking, reading or writing. They may forget how to brush their teeth or comb their hair. Later on, they may become anxious or aggressive, or wander away from home. Eventually, they need total care. This can cause great stress for family members who must care for them.

AD usually begins after age 60. The risk goes up as you get older. Your risk is also higher if a family member has had the disease.

No treatment can stop the disease. However, some drugs may help keep symptoms from getting worse for a limited time.

NIH: National Institute on Aging
indications: prevention of alzheimer's disease in people with mild cognitive impairment
condition.name: Alzheimer's disease

indications: Prevention of Alzheimer's disease in people with Mild Cognitive Impairment

carousel_items: Take Donepezil in the evening or before going to bed. Can be taken with or without food.
Can cause increased stomach acid (and possibly heartburn), especially if you're also taking anti-inflammatory medications like NSAIDs.
Can cause nausea, diarrhea, and stomach cramps.
If you're taking the orally disintegrating tablet (ODT), place it on your tongue and let it dissolve, then drink a full cup of water.
The oral tablet shouldn’t be split, crushed, or chewed.
If you've missed seven doses in a row, you'll need to call your doctor about restarting the medication properly again.

basics.benefits_moa: Donepezil is an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor. Researchers don't know exactly how it helps treat Alzheimer's disease, but it prevents acetylcholine, a chemical in the brain, from being broken down too quickly. Acetylcholine is important in transmitting signals through nerves, a process that breaks down in Alzheimer's.
basics.bottom_line: Donepezil works for all stages of dementia caused by Alzheimer's, but it can be expensive.
downsides: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Like other medications for dementia, it only slows down the progression of the disease; it doesn't stop or reverse it.
Donepezil is not a good choice for people with heart problems or a slow heart rate. It can slow the heart rate down and cause dizziness or fainting.

downsides_processed.orig: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Like other medications for dementia, it only slows down the progression of the disease; it doesn't stop or reverse it.
Donepezil is not a good choice for people with heart problems or a slow heart rate. It can slow the heart rate down and cause dizziness or fainting.

upsides: Donepezil can be used to treat dementia caused by all stages of Alzheimer's.
It can be effective for treating behavioral problems related to dementia.
Available in three different forms: immediate release solution, a tablet, and an orally disintegrating tablet.

upsides_processed.orig: Donepezil can be used to treat dementia caused by all stages of Alzheimer's.
It can be effective for treating behavioral problems related to dementia.
Available in three different forms: immediate release solution, a tablet, and an orally disintegrating tablet.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Donepezil in the evening or before going to bed. Can be taken with or without food.
Can cause increased stomach acid (and possibly heartburn), especially if you're also taking anti-inflammatory medications like NSAIDs.
Can cause nausea, diarrhea, and stomach cramps.
If you're taking the orally disintegrating tablet (ODT), place it on your tongue and let it dissolve, then drink a full cup of water.
The oral tablet shouldn’t be split, crushed, or chewed.
If you've missed seven doses in a row, you'll need to call your doctor about restarting the medication properly again.

risks_warnings.title: Ulcers | Bleeding in the stomach
risks_warnings.description: People on Donepezil have reported stomach ulcers which can also lead to bleeding in the stomach and intestines. Taking medications for inflammation, such as NSAIDs (ibuprofen or naproxen), can make this worse. Talk to your doctor if you vomit blood or material that looks like coffee grounds, or if your stool has blood or looks black and tarry. You can help prevent this by having some food or milk in your stomach when you take the medication.

description_processed.orig: People on Donepezil have reported stomach ulcers which can also lead to bleeding in the stomach and intestines. Taking medications for inflammation, such as NSAIDs (ibuprofen or naproxen), can make this worse. Talk to your doctor if you vomit blood or material that looks like coffee grounds, or if your stool has blood or looks black and tarry. You can help prevent this by having some food or milk in your stomach when you take the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Nausea and vomiting
risks_warnings.description: People on Donepezil have reported nausea and vomiting, especially when they first start taking the medication or if they have to increase the dose. This is common and should only last up to three weeks. If this bothers you, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Donepezil have reported nausea and vomiting, especially when they first start taking the medication or if they have to increase the dose. This is common and should only last up to three weeks. If this bothers you, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Weight loss
risks_warnings.description: People on Donepezil have reported weight loss. This is common. If this bothers you, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: Namenda XR capsules can be swallowed whole and shouldn't be chewed or crushed. But they can be opened and sprinkled in a small amount of applesauce.
If using the oral solution, use the dosing device that comes with the medication. Slowly squirt the dose into the corner of mouth and don't mix it with any other liquids.
Namenda can cause dizziness, headache, or constipation.
If you've missed several doses in a row, you'll need to call your doctor about restarting the medication properly again.

basics.benefits_moa: Namenda is an NMDA receptor antagonist. Researchers don't know exactly how it helps treat Alzheimer's disease, but it blocks an amino acid called glutamine, which seems to protect nerves from overstimulation.
basics.bottom_line: Namenda is one of the few medications that can be used to treat moderate to severe dementia caused by Alzheimer's, but it can be expensive.
downsides: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Like other medications for dementia, it only slows down the progression of the disease; it doesn't stop or reverse it.

downsides_processed.orig: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Like other medications for dementia, it only slows down the progression of the disease; it doesn't stop or reverse it.

upsides: Only used to treat moderate to severe dementia caused by Alzheimer's disease.
It's available as an immediate-release tablet, a solution, and an extended-release tablet.
Can cause fewer side effects than other medicines used to treat Alzheimer's disease.

upsides_processed.orig: Only used to treat moderate to severe dementia caused by Alzheimer's disease.
It's available as an immediate-release tablet, a solution, and an extended-release tablet.
Can cause fewer side effects than other medicines used to treat Alzheimer's disease.

drugs.name: Namenda

carousel_items_processed.orig: Namenda XR capsules can be swallowed whole and shouldn't be chewed or crushed. But they can be opened and sprinkled in a small amount of applesauce.
If using the oral solution, use the dosing device that comes with the medication. Slowly squirt the dose into the corner of mouth and don't mix it with any other liquids.
Namenda can cause dizziness, headache, or constipation.
If you've missed several doses in a row, you'll need to call your doctor about restarting the medication properly again.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Namenda has been shown to raise the chances of someone having a seizure if they've had seizures in the past. Talk to your doctor if you've had a history of seizures to see if an alternative should be prescribed instead.

description_processed.orig: Namenda has been shown to raise the chances of someone having a seizure if they've had seizures in the past. Talk to your doctor if you've had a history of seizures to see if an alternative should be prescribed instead.

risks_warnings.title: Mood changes
risks_warnings.description: People on Namenda have reported changes in their mood. This has been rare. Talk to your doctor if you start to feel depressed or a change in the way that you act.

description_processed.orig: People on Namenda have reported changes in their mood. This has been rare. Talk to your doctor if you start to feel depressed or a change in the way that you act.

carousel_items: Exelon can cause nausea, vomiting, and dizziness.
Avoid activities that require full mental attention until you know how the drug affects you.
Let your doctor know if you get serious stomach problems, issues with movement (tremor), or weight loss.
If using the patch, make sure you know how to apply it. To prevent skin irritation, change the location of the patch every day.
If using the oral solution, take it after meals to prevent an upset stomach. It can be mixed with cold water, juice, or soda.

clock.tip: Taking with food makes you feel better, but it slows the medication's actions.

basics.benefits_moa: Exelon is an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor. Researchers don't know exactly how it helps treat Alzheimer's disease, but it prevents acetylcholine, a chemical in the brain, from being broken down too quickly. Acetylcholine is important in transmitting signals through nerves, a process that breaks down in Alzheimer's.
basics.bottom_line: Exelon works for all stages of dementia caused by Alzheimer's, and the oral version is cheaper than the patch.
downsides: Like other medications for dementia, it only slows down the progression of the disease, but it doesn't stop or reverse it.
You need to take the oral capsules twice a day.
The patches are brand name only, so they can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Like other medications for dementia, it only slows down the progression of the disease, but it doesn't stop or reverse it.
You need to take the oral capsules twice a day.
The patches are brand name only, so they can be expensive.

upsides: Can be used to treat dementia caused by all stages of Alzheimer's disease.
Exelon slows the progression of Alzheimer's, including the person's cognitive function and ability to perform the usual daily living activities.
It also improves behavior disorders related to Alzheimer's.
Exelon is available as a patch. This form causes fewer stomach problems (like nausea or vomiting).
The oral capsules are available as a generic medication.

upsides_processed.orig: Can be used to treat dementia caused by all stages of Alzheimer's disease.
Exelon slows the progression of Alzheimer's, including the person's cognitive function and ability to perform the usual daily living activities.
It also improves behavior disorders related to Alzheimer's.
Exelon is available as a patch. This form causes fewer stomach problems (like nausea or vomiting).
The oral capsules are available as a generic medication.

drugs.name: Exelon

carousel_items_processed.orig: Exelon can cause nausea, vomiting, and dizziness.
Avoid activities that require full mental attention until you know how the drug affects you.
Let your doctor know if you get serious stomach problems, issues with movement (tremor), or weight loss.
If using the patch, make sure you know how to apply it. To prevent skin irritation, change the location of the patch every day.
If using the oral solution, take it after meals to prevent an upset stomach. It can be mixed with cold water, juice, or soda.

risks_warnings.title: Nausea and vomiting | Weight loss
risks_warnings.description: People on Exelon have reported nausea and vomiting, decreased appetite and weight loss. This usually happens when the medication is first started and when there are changes in the dose. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern, especially if you have to stop taking the medication for more than 3 days.

description_processed.orig: People on Exelon have reported nausea and vomiting, decreased appetite and weight loss. This usually happens when the medication is first started and when there are changes in the dose. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern, especially if you have to stop taking the medication for more than 3 days.

risks_warnings.title: Skin sensitivity
risks_warnings.description: People on Exelon have reported skin sensitivity and irritation in oral and skin patch forms, but especially with the skin patch. If you notice sensitivity and irritation to your skin, especially around the area where the patch is placed and if it doesn't go away after the patch is removed, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Exelon have reported skin sensitivity and irritation in oral and skin patch forms, but especially with the skin patch. If you notice sensitivity and irritation to your skin, especially around the area where the patch is placed and if it doesn't go away after the patch is removed, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle tremors
risks_warnings.description: People on Exelon have reported muscle tremors, especially if they have Parkinson's. Talk to your doctor if this bothers you.

description_processed.orig: People on Exelon have reported muscle tremors, especially if they have Parkinson's. Talk to your doctor if this bothers you.

risks_warnings.title: Ulcers | Bleeding in the stomach
risks_warnings.description: People on Exelon have reported stomach ulcers which can also lead to bleeding in the stomach and intestines. Taking medications for inflammation, such as NSAIDs (ibuprofen or naproxen), can make this worse. Talk to your doctor if you vomit blood or material that looks like coffee grounds, or if your stool has blood or looks black and tarry. You can help prevent this by having some food or milk in your stomach when you take the oral medication.

carousel_items: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Don't use if pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
May cause hair loss and weight gain.
Different versions of Depakote have different dosing. Be careful.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes 3 to 4 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

basics.benefits_moa: Depakote is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to increase the amount of GABA, a chemical that calms nerves in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Depakote is good long-term prevention for epilepsy, bipolar disorder, and migraines, but can cause weight gain.
downsides: Can cause upset stomach, hair loss, weight gain, sleepiness, and tremor.
Can cause liver damage, so it's probably not safe if you already have liver problems.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause upset stomach, hair loss, weight gain, sleepiness, and tremor.
Can cause liver damage, so it's probably not safe if you already have liver problems.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with absence, tonic-clonic, and complex partial seizures.
One of the first-line options to stabilize mood for people with bipolar disorder.
Helpful in preventing frequent migraine headaches.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with absence, tonic-clonic, and complex partial seizures.
One of the first-line options to stabilize mood for people with bipolar disorder.
Helpful in preventing frequent migraine headaches.

userStories.tip: It caused me to gain 15 pounds in a month and gave me headaches. I

Noticeable weight gain around my gut. Had to start dieting and running on tread mill to combat the weight gain. Did not eliminate migraines, but made them less frequent and less intense. Now I can usually knock them out with a sumatriptan.

Causes major hair loss, "brain fog," drains your motivation...not worth it, especially the short-acting formula (valproic acid - Depakene).  Ironically, it GAVE me migraines, instead of preventing them (one of its purported purposes.)
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: shaky hands, hair loss, memory loss and felt sleepy all day. It worked for my epilepsy, but i hate those side effects

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: The side effects can be extreme: hand tremors, weight gain, memory issues, and others.

drugs.name: Depakote

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Don't use if pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
May cause hair loss and weight gain.
Different versions of Depakote have different dosing. Be careful.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes 3 to 4 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

risks_warnings.title: Pancreatitis
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to high ammonia
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

risks_warnings.title: Low body temperature
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Depakote suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Depakote, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Depakote suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Depakote, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

carousel_items: Take Donepezil in the evening or before going to bed. Can be taken with or without food.
Can cause increased stomach acid (and possibly heartburn), especially if you're also taking anti-inflammatory medications like NSAIDs.
Can cause nausea, diarrhea, and stomach cramps.
If you're taking the orally disintegrating tablet (ODT), place it on your tongue and let it dissolve, then drink a full cup of water.
The oral tablet shouldn’t be split, crushed, or chewed.
If you've missed seven doses in a row, you'll need to call your doctor about restarting the medication properly again.

basics.benefits_moa: Donepezil is an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor. Researchers don't know exactly how it helps treat Alzheimer's disease, but it prevents acetylcholine, a chemical in the brain, from being broken down too quickly. Acetylcholine is important in transmitting signals through nerves, a process that breaks down in Alzheimer's.
basics.bottom_line: Donepezil works for all stages of dementia caused by Alzheimer's, but it can be expensive.
downsides: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Like other medications for dementia, it only slows down the progression of the disease; it doesn't stop or reverse it.
Donepezil is not a good choice for people with heart problems or a slow heart rate. It can slow the heart rate down and cause dizziness or fainting.

downsides_processed.orig: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Like other medications for dementia, it only slows down the progression of the disease; it doesn't stop or reverse it.
Donepezil is not a good choice for people with heart problems or a slow heart rate. It can slow the heart rate down and cause dizziness or fainting.

upsides: Donepezil can be used to treat dementia caused by all stages of Alzheimer's.
It can be effective for treating behavioral problems related to dementia.
Available in three different forms: immediate release solution, a tablet, and an orally disintegrating tablet.

It can be effective for treating behavioral problems related to dementia.
Available in three different forms: immediate release solution, a tablet, and an orally disintegrating tablet.

drugs.name: Aricept

off-label_indications.indication: Prevention of Alzheimer's disease in people with Mild Cognitive Impairment

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Donepezil in the evening or before going to bed. Can be taken with or without food.
Can cause increased stomach acid (and possibly heartburn), especially if you're also taking anti-inflammatory medications like NSAIDs.
Can cause nausea, diarrhea, and stomach cramps.
If you're taking the orally disintegrating tablet (ODT), place it on your tongue and let it dissolve, then drink a full cup of water.
The oral tablet shouldn’t be split, crushed, or chewed.
If you've missed seven doses in a row, you'll need to call your doctor about restarting the medication properly again.

risks_warnings.title: Ulcers | Bleeding in the stomach
risks_warnings.description: People on Donepezil have reported stomach ulcers which can also lead to bleeding in the stomach and intestines. Taking medications for inflammation, such as NSAIDs (ibuprofen or naproxen), can make this worse. Talk to your doctor if you vomit blood or material that looks like coffee grounds, or if your stool has blood or looks black and tarry. You can help prevent this by having some food or milk in your stomach when you take the medication.

description_processed.orig: People on Donepezil have reported stomach ulcers which can also lead to bleeding in the stomach and intestines. Taking medications for inflammation, such as NSAIDs (ibuprofen or naproxen), can make this worse. Talk to your doctor if you vomit blood or material that looks like coffee grounds, or if your stool has blood or looks black and tarry. You can help prevent this by having some food or milk in your stomach when you take the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Nausea and vomiting
risks_warnings.description: People on Donepezil have reported nausea and vomiting, especially when they first start taking the medication or if they have to increase the dose. This is common and should only last up to three weeks. If this bothers you, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Donepezil have reported nausea and vomiting, especially when they first start taking the medication or if they have to increase the dose. This is common and should only last up to three weeks. If this bothers you, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Weight loss
risks_warnings.description: People on Donepezil have reported weight loss. This is common. If this bothers you, talk to your doctor.
